Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre

Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre(KLCC)

The nearest tourist attraction to Kajang would be KLCC. Why is KLCC a tourist attraction?

  • KLCC is a multipurpose development area located in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia.
  • The whole site of KLCC is 100 acre big designed to be a city within a city. Therefore, the site hosts several developments including the tallest twin buildings in the world, a shopping mall, office buildings, a park, a mosque and several hotels
  • The main local attraction that is opened for the public to visit would be Suria KLCC as it the the commercial center or people would generally call it a shopping megamall
  • Tourist would mainly go to Lake Symphony which is within the KLCC park during the night as there are two musical fountains display over 150 unique programmed animations in a magical performance of sound and water. The display is specifically known as KLCC Lake Symphony Light and Sound Water Fountain
  • Within the Twin Tower, tourist would also be attracted to the Petrosains Discovery Centre. It is a a highly interactive educational adventure that lets children and adults experience fun and excitement of learning. The exhibits and shows offer a hands-on approach to stimulate interest in general science and technology, as well as the energy industry.
  • Another attraction within the KLCC would be Aquaria KLCC. It is located below the building, with a 90-metre long transparent tunnel, where it showcases the wide variety of exhibits of marine life from Malaysia and around the world, guided tours, and even interactive feeding shows.
  • KLCC also has a non-profit art gallery known as PETRONAS Art Gallery, with over 1,000 works of art ranging from a wide variety of origins and styles.

Source: Attractions in Suria KLCC
